list-item.label: â€¢
list-item.p: The extensive requirement for protein cleavage during the coronavirus replication cycle has made the viral papain-like (Plpro) and chymotrypsin-like (3Clpro) proteases major targets for drug development. Highly specific small-molecule inhibitors of both enzymes have been identified that inhibit the SARS coronavirus, and might also be used to image infections ( Ghosh et al., 2008, Ratia et al., 2008).
